pr_title: Set alias name in resultTable schema names

timeline.message: Set alias name in response schema names

timeline.author: Jackie-Jiang

replies.bodyText: Good point, will remove this logging, and let it return directly
replies.author: xiangfu0

timeline.author: Jackie-Jiang

timeline.bodyText: Cache selectList.get(i).getFunctionCall(), same for other places
timeline.author: Jackie-Jiang

timeline.bodyText: Can you simplify the logic here and add some comments? Can aliasName be null when AS keyword is found?
timeline.author: Jackie-Jiang

replies.bodyText: technically it shouldn't be null, this is just for sanity check.
replies.author: xiangfu0

timeline.bodyText: What is the SQL standard for AS keyword? Can it work on FUNCTION and LITERAL? If not, we should add sanity check here to block the query. The query should always to valid when it goes to the query engine.
timeline.author: Jackie-Jiang

replies.bodyText: It's up to us to set it, here we compile it into a function call with operator = 'AS', operands[0] as alias_from_expression and operands[0] as alias_to_expression
replies.author: xiangfu0

timeline.bodyText: Please add some comments explaining why this can happen
timeline.author: Jackie-Jiang

timeline.bodyText: We should not perform sanity check here, but when we compile the query. At this point, alias should always exist and should always be identifier.
timeline.author: Jackie-Jiang

replies.bodyText: make sense, will update the query parsing logic there.
replies.author: xiangfu0
